titles.title: HEATR Act of 2011
Home Energy Affordability Tax Relief Act of 2011
HEATR Act of 2011
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a refundable credit against income tax to assist individuals with high residential energy costs.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Home Energy Affordability Tax Relief Act of 2011 or the HEATR Act of 2011- Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an individual taxpayer an income-based refundable tax credit for energy costs for the taxpayer's principal residence. Limits such credit to the lesser of 33% of such costs or $500. Terminates such credit on December 31, 2012.
